div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1499 Tell el Mellaha, just S of Beirut (anc. Berytus), Phoenicia, c. 1887 Burial: c. 333 B.C. (Naster) Contents: 60 70 AR Sidon: double-shekels (Tennes to Mazaeus) Disposition: J. Rouvier some (Newell records acquiring a few from Rouvier but his tickets do not identify the coins) Rouvier, RN 1896, p. 389; 1902, p. 255 Naster, INCJ, pp. 5, 10, 19
